lines: You and ${loverName} have just had a nice, romantic date. You have treated her well all evening -- movies, a bite to eat, the works. Now you are feeling very romantic, but for some strange reason, ${loverName} only wants to engage in idle chit chat.
Every time you try to kiss her, she turns her face away and says, "Let's just talk." How do you feel?
Fine, ${loverName} says, "Then please stop 'chit-chatting' with your hand on my leg."
What will you do as a result of your frustration?

Not being fair about what? She wants to talk, you want to kiss. The two of you are disagreeing. If she is being unfair because she's not doing what YOU want, then you are being equally as unfair for not doing what SHE wants.

Expressing your frustration keeps you from acting on your feelings in an inappropriate way. Still, she doesn't feel like doing anything. Talking about your feelings doesn't always change the way things are. At least you made
your needs understood in a direct way.
What a big baby! Can't you respect her right to not want to kiss you? Maybe she has something on her mind. The evening ends with a fight.
